Blood Diamond (2006) <a href=" http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0450259/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0450259/</a>
A blood diamond (also called a conflict diamond, converted diamond, hot diamond, or war diamond) is a term used for a diamond mined in a war zone and sold to finance an insurgency, an invading army's war efforts... 
The term is used to highlight the negative consequences of the diamond trade in certain areas.
Set during the Sierra Leone Civil War in 1996-2001, the film depicts a country torn apart by the struggle between government loyalists and insurgent forces. It also portrays many of the atrocities of that war, including the rebels' amputation of people's hands to discourage them from voting in upcoming elections.
